uk.ac.ed.bikerental

Class DateRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.bikerental.DateRange

  • public class DateRange
extends java.lang.Object
    The DateRange class provides a powerful way to represent a collection of consecutive dates. When given a start date and and end date in the LocalDate format, this class represents those dates and all dates inbetween, allowing for things such as checking for overlap.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DateRange(java.time.LocalDate start, java.time.LocalDate end)
      The constructor for the DateRange - generates a DateRange object when given a start and end date in the LocalDate format.

      A getter for the start variable.
      int hashCode()
      Implements the hashCode method for DateRange, allowing for use in collections.
      java.lang.Boolean overlaps(DateRange otherDate)
      Compares two DateRange objects and checks for any overlap between them, including cases where the two DateRanges are equal, or have the same start/end date.
      long toDays()
      Converts a DateRange into the number of days between its start and end date, using the Java ChronoUnit type.
      long toMonths()
      Converts a DateRange into the number of months between its start and end date, using the Java ChronoUnit type.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Implements the toString method for DateRange, allowing for representation of the object in a string format, useful for debugging purposes.
      long toYears()
      Converts a DateRange into the number of years between its start and end date, using the Java ChronoUnit type.

      • overlaps

        public java.lang.Boolean overlaps(DateRange otherDate)
        Compares two DateRange objects and checks for any overlap between them, including cases where the two DateRanges are equal, or have the same start/end date.
        Parameters:
        otherDate - The date to compare to
        Returns:
        A boolean value of whether or not there is overlap between the two DateRanges.
